translated: Amylon, Nils, dentist, Gothenburg, born February 28, 1905 in HälsingboTg to J.A. Amyloin and Anna Boman. Married 1st to Anna-Liisa Paulison for 33 years, and 2nd to Brita Svensison for 45 years. Children: Margot born in 1935, Rodif born in 1937, Nils Ol-oif born in 1939. He passed his student exams in Hälsingborg in 1924, became a dental student in 1927 and a dental practitioner in 1930. Worked in Eskilstuna in 1930, then worked as a practice owner and consultant dentist in Ängelholm and also as a coal mine dentist in Barkåkra 'S:t. He has been in the service of Gothenburg since 1941. He was a scholarship recipient of the Schultzberg Foundation at the Charité in Berlin, the West German Jaw Clinic in Düsseldorf-Morf, and the Krupp Dental Clinic in Essen in 1936. He was the secretary of the North V. Skåne Dental Association in 1935, the club master there in 1938, and the chairman in 1939. He was a member of Ängelholm's construction committee in 1940, and the chairman of the official section of the Gothenburg Dental Association division from 1942-47. He was the secretary of the Gothenburg Dental Association from 1943-47.
